intro: Thlaspi glaucum var. hesperium, commonly known as the Pacific rockcress, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or coastal environments. Its compact form and ability to tolerate harsh conditions make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
